conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the transparent material for monochromatic light.
A semicircular brick with radius R is made of transparent material; laser beam injected perpendicular to diameter MN at point O, offset by R/2 from center.
When laser beam shifts, only monochromatic light is emitted at 30 degrees to incident direction.
Total internal reflection occurs when angle of incidence is greater than critical angle.
Critical angle related to refractive index by sin(theta_c) = 1/n.
Incident light hits semicircle at angle such that refracted light exits at 30 degrees relative to normal.
Angle of incidence and refraction related by Snell's Law: n sin(theta_1) = sin(theta_2).
For TIR, theta_1 must equal critical angle theta_c.
Simplifying gives contradiction, suggesting need to re-evaluate setup.
Angle of 30 degrees is deviation from normal at exit point.
Deviation indicates angle between refracted ray and normal is 30 degrees.
Theta_2 = 30 degrees is angle of refraction.
Using Snell's Law: n sin(theta_1) = sin(30 degrees) = 1/2.
